quest.name: A Hero in the Making
journal: Minfilia is wearing a wry smile. Might it have something to do with your newfound fame?

It would seem your recent exploits have garnered the attention of all three of the Grand Companies of Eorzea. Now each one is intent upon adding you to its ranks, going so far as to send a representative to the Waking Sands to court you. Though Minfilia does not seem best pleased by this turn of events, she concedes that joining a Grand Company would yield certain benefits. But which one will you choose? That you might make an informed decision, she suggests that you attend the forthcoming remembrance services and listen to each Grand Company leader's address. Tataru will be able to furnish you with the particulars.

Tataru has apprised you as to where the remembrance services are due to be held. Visit Mih Khetto's Amphitheatre in Gridania, the Royal Promenade in Ul'dah, and finally the Stateroom in Limsa Lominsa, and hear what the Grand Company leaders have to say.

You have now attended all three of the remembrance services. Based on the words of the Grand Company leaders and the traveling twins, Alphinaud and Alisaie, it would appear that each of Eorzea's city–states is beset with problems. Clearly, all three would benefit from your aid, but which of them deserves it most? Make your way back to the Waking Sands, and share your thoughts with Minfilia.

Minfilia confirms that all three city–states are sorely in need of assistance, and laments the fact that there is only one of you. A difficult choice awaits. Weigh your decision well, and give your answer to the officer of the Grand Company you would join.
objectives: Attend the remembrance service at Mih Khetto's Amphitheatre in Gridania.
Attend the remembrance service at the Royal Promenade in Ul'dah.
Attend the remembrance service at the Stateroom in Limsa Lominsa.
Report to Minfilia at the Waking Sands.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Until not so very long ago, you were but one of the many adventurers seeking to make their way in Eorzea.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: But for your character and courage, you were raised to the esteemed post of envoy. Thereafter, you traveled the realm, aiding those in need without thought of reward, confirming to Y'shtolaYda and PapalymoThancred that the Scions would benefit from your aid. And no sooner had you joined us than you personally bested the primal Ifrit.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: You have achieved a great deal in a short time, and won fame in so doing. Alas, fame does not come without a price, as you will soon discover.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: We have guests, Forename─or rather...you have guests.

dialogue.name: THREEOFFICER
dialogue.text: (-???-)Beg pardons!

dialogue.name: FLAMEOFFICER
dialogue.text: Ahhh, Lady Minfilia. Radiant as always!

dialogue.name: SERPENTOFFICER
dialogue.text: I am given to understand that the Scions of the Seventh Dawn have but recently welcomed a new hero into their midst!

dialogue.name: STORMOFFICER
dialogue.text: I am here on behalf of the Maelstrom, Grand Company of Limsa Lominsa, to offer said hero a place of honor within our ranks!

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: As you can see, Forename, your recent exploits have garnered you the attentions of the Grand Companies of Eorzea.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Each organization would have Ifrit's bane for its own. To this end, all three have sent officers to court you.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: They would not ordinarily go to such lengths to enlist a new recruit. That they have is evidence of their high regard for you.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: I find myself wondering how word of Forename's deeds spread so quickly. That the Immortal Flames should know of herhis triumph is to be expected...but what of the other Grand Companies?

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Eep!

dialogue.name: SERPENTOFFICER
dialogue.text: Your reputation precedes you, MistressMaster Surname! 'Tis no ordinary womanman who can face a primal and emerge the victor!

dialogue.name: SERPENTOFFICER
dialogue.text: And imagine our pride when we learned that you began your journey as an adventurer in our own Gridania! Know that the people hold you in high esteem, and that you will always be welcome among us.

dialogue.name: SERPENTOFFICER
dialogue.text: The Order of the Twin Adder has need of valiant womenmen such as you. Join your strength to ours, friend, and together let us ensure that peace ever reigns over the Twelveswood!

dialogue.name: FLAMEOFFICER
dialogue.text: What a pleasure it is to finally meet you, MistressMaster Surname! My comrades speak of you in the most glowing terms!

dialogue.name: FLAMEOFFICER
dialogue.text: Why, even before you aided us against the Amalj'aa and their dread primal, yours was already a respected name in Ul'dah. Our people know you and love you well.

dialogue.name: FLAMEOFFICER
dialogue.text: A womanman of your talent belongs with the Immortal Flames. Join your strength to ours, friend, and together let us secure a prosperous future for Ul'dah!

dialogue.name: STORMOFFICER
dialogue.text: The Admiral was not exaggerating when she said you have the look of a hero! Full often does she speak of you, friend.

dialogue.name: STORMOFFICER
dialogue.text: ...As do many others in Limsa. Long before the rest of Eorzea took note, your name was well known to us, owing to your valorous deeds on behalf of our citizens.

dialogue.name: STORMOFFICER
dialogue.text: It is only natural that we should want you for the Maelstrom. Join your strength to ours, and together let us see the grand vessel of Limsa Lominsa to the shores of glory!

dialogue.name: THREEOFFICER
dialogue.text: (-Grand Company Officers-)Lady Minfilia!

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: <sigh> Very well...

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Though I am quite sure you need no reminding, mayhap a brief summary of the situation would help to clarify your thoughts on this matter. As you know, the Grand Companies are all-encompassing organizations empowered to call upon the martial, economic, and technological resources of their respective city–states in times of strife.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: There are presently three such organizations in Eorzea: the Maelstrom of Limsa Lominsa, the Order of the Twin Adder of Gridania, and the Immortal Flames of Ul'dah.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Serving a Grand Company means serving the nation to which it belongs. You will be charged with its defense, and tasked with advancing its cause.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: In return for your faithful service, you will be furnished with various rewards, some of which may well prove useful to you in your other endeavors.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: If you are agonizing over which of the Grand Companies best deserves your loyalty, be at ease─the commitment you make this day need not be permanent. Should you wish to shift your allegiance at a later date, you are entitled to do so. And yet...I concede that it is no small choice you face...

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Ah! A thought occurs to me! You will, of course, recall that the three city–states are planning to hold remembrance services.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Well, as part of the proceedings, I am given to understand that the leader of each Grand Company will deliver an address.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Hearing these addresses ought to help you make an informed decision. What say you, my dear officers?

dialogue.name: SERPENTOFFICER
dialogue.text: A fine suggestion!

dialogue.name: FLAMEOFFICER
dialogue.text: You are as wise as you are beautiful, my lady!

dialogue.name: STORMOFFICER
dialogue.text: Very well! Let Forename hear our leaders speak, then return here with herhis decision.

dialogue.name: THREEOFFICER
dialogue.text: (-Grand Company Officers-)We eagerly await your answer!

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: I know full well that adventurers are by their nature a liberty-loving breed, and not best suited to the discipline of military service, but I strongly urge you to join a Grand Company nonetheless. While the promise of reward is enticing in itself, it is not the only benefit.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: You are possessed of great power, Forename, and with it you are capable of doing untold good. Yet know that great power is wont to attract attention─not all of it friendly.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: There will be those who wish you ill, and you must needs be on the lookout for them. Yet however vigilant you are, you are but one womanman. In the midst of a Grand Company, however, you will be one womanman amongst many─a friend amongst friends. Your achievements will be shared, and so will the danger. I can think of no better arrangement.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Of course, joining one organization need not mean leaving another. I hope that we can continue to rely upon your aid─the Twelve know that we will have need of it in the days ahead.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: The Grand Companies seek to protect their own nations. We Scions, on the other hand, seek to preserve the future of Eorzea as a whole. Similar, yet not quite the same.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Now then, I expect that you will be afield more often in the future.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: As such, I would have you carry this linkpearl with you at all times. It will allow us to stay in touch regardless of location.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Eorzea is changing, Forename, and you have the power to help shape it anew.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: None can say what the morrow will bring, but so long as we believe in ourselves, there is naught we cannot achieve.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Now, it is time you made ready for your journey. Before you depart, be sure to speak to Tataru. She will apprise you as to where and when the remembrance services are due to take place.

dialogue.name: FLAMEOFFICER
dialogue.text: The Flame General is a passionate man, and his words never fail to light a fire in the belly of those who listen. I am sure you will be no exception!

dialogue.name: SERPENTOFFICER
dialogue.text: The Elder Seedseer speaks only truth, and her words have the power to touch the soul. At the sound of her voice, all fall silent and attend her.

dialogue.name: STORMOFFICER
dialogue.text: When the Admiral speaks, even pirates listen, and that is no small thing. She is a born leader─the kind one would gladly follow to the seventh hell!

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: I, um... I'm sorry about all the attention you're getting, Forename... I might have sung your praises a little too loudly...and often...to a few too many people. Ahem. Next time, I'll be sure to hold my tongue─literally, if necessary.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Anyway, I expect you want to know where and when the remembrance services are taking place?

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: If all goes to plan, Gridania's Grand Company, the Order of the Twin Adder, will hold the first of the three services, and Elder Seedseer Kan–E–Senna will deliver her address at Mih Khetto's Amphitheatre.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: I should probably mention at this point that due to the organizational challenges involved in assembling all of the involved parties, it's possible that the order of the services might change... Still, there's not much we can do about that, so make Gridania your first port of call.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Next, you'll need to go to Ul'dah, where Flame General Raubahn Aldynn will be addressing the masses at the Royal Promenade. Oh, and it's rumored there's to be a special guest! How exciting.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Last but not least, you must make your way to the Stateroom in Limsa Lominsa, where Maelstrom Chief Admiral Merlwyb Bloefhiswyn will be giving her address.

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: The room is accessible via the Admiral's Lift. Identify yourself to the sentry, Zanthael, and he will admit you. Got all that?

dialogue.name: TATARU
dialogue.text: Well, off you go, then. I hope you find the remembrance services suitably educational! I suggest visiting the city–states in my prescribed order, though with your record of impeccable timing and luck, the schedule may well change in favor of your preferred travel plans. Farewell!

dialogue.name: CLATTERM
dialogue.text: Behold, it is the Sultana Nanamo herself!

dialogue.name: CLATTERF
dialogue.text: And Raubahn as well!

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Hark you, souls of flame, drawn to the bosom of the desert, where the fire burns brightest and shall rage forevermore!

dialogue.name: CLATTERM
dialogue.text: HURRAH!

dialogue.name: CLATTERM
dialogue.text: RAUBAHN!

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Where since antiquity, under the sage and judicious rule of the Ul Dynasty, we have wrought sand into gold!

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Where by the Grace and Glory of Nald'thal have our brave sons and daughters flourished and prospered─I speak of Ul'dah!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: (-Self-assured YouthAlphinaud-)There, at the Flame General's back flies the Grand Company's standard.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: (-Self-assured YouthAlphinaud-)Note the sigil. The golden scales of order balance the jewel of prosperity with the flame of might.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Great and many are the gifts our nation has given the realm.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: In Eorzea's darkest hour, on the killing fields of Carteneau, none spent more in blood and gold than we.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Thus was the VIIth Imperial Legion laid low!

dialogue.name: CLATTERM
dialogue.text: Raaah!

dialogue.name: CLATTERM
dialogue.text: Yaaah!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: (-Self-assured YouthAlphinaud-)So that's how it happened! How soon history forgets.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Yet many left our gates, never to return.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Let us pray for our absent brothers and sisters, that they might know happiness in the great beyond, as Thal's honored guests.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: If the fates were fair, the price we paid that day would have bought us victory. Alas, they are not.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: And now, but five years into this Seventh Umbral Era, the spirit of sacrifice which granted us our strength is all but dead.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Look around you. What do you see? A people divided, downtrodden and enthralled!

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Where are the merciful alms of the rich? Where is the just steel of the righteous?

dialogue.name: CLATTERM
dialogue.text: That's not really fair...

dialogue.name: CLATTERF
dialogue.text: It is as he says.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: I ask you: is this the great nation our brothers and sisters gave their lives to save?

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: You who call this “living” dishonor the name of the Immortal Flames─it is but a slow death!

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Our enemies surround us. The savage hordes of the Amalj'aa wait beside our roads, strangling the lifelines of trade.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Meanwhile, the Garleans make mock of our borders, and despoil our land of its natural wealth.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: We stand on a precipice...yet we do not act.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Whether trader or soldier, Monetarist or Royalist, all must recognize that a divided Ul'dah stands to fall.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Victory and Fortune walk hand in hand!

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Ye who seek glory and wealth! Look not to what little you can snatch from your neighbor, but to the boundless wealth of the world beyond!

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Now is the time to unite! Now is the time to ride forth!

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: In the name of the sultana, I beseech you!

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Line not your own coffers, but those of the Immortal Flames! Seek not to prosper from Ul'dah, but to restore her to prosperity!

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: As the realm prospers, so shall Ul'dah. As Ul'dah prospers, so shall her people!

dialogue.name: CLATTERM
dialogue.text: Yah! For Ul'dah!

dialogue.name: CLATTERF
dialogue.text: Together we are one!

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Your Grace.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: Raubahn.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: People of Ul'dah! I, Nanamo, seventeenth in the line of Ul, address you.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: Much has been made of the wealth of Ul'dah.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: Yet those who measure that wealth in coins and carats are gravely deceived.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: For the true wealth of Ul'dah lies in the health, happiness, and hopes of her people.

dialogue.name: NANAMOULNAMO
dialogue.text: Beloved subjects, I bid you raise aloft the torch of Ul'dah, that her Flames might serve as a beacon for all Eorzea to see!

dialogue.name: CLATTERM
dialogue.text: Long live Nanamo!

dialogue.name: CLATTERM
dialogue.text: Glory to the sultana!

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: For Victory and Fortune, stride fearless into the inferno, for we are by fire reborn!

dialogue.name: CLATTERM
dialogue.text: Forsooth!

dialogue.name: CLATTERM
dialogue.text: The time is now!

dialogue.name: CLATTERM
dialogue.text: I believe!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: If you'll permit me. Alphinaud.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...And my sister, Alisaie, at your service.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I saw at a glance that you were a fellow traveler.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: You might call us students of history, sampling the realm's remembrances in pursuit of...enlightenment.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Fancy meeting you again.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The Ul'dahns have a long history of conflict with the Amalj'aa, the beast tribe that worships the primal Ifrit.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Judging by your look of distaste, I take it you have encountered them.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The Ul'dahns do not shy from confrontation. If aught threatens their precious prosperity, they will seek to crush it.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: So have they dealt with Ifrit thus far, smothering his flames each time he is stoked to life.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Yet he is but one of several problems. Though they have been quiet these past five years, the Garleans have not gone away.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Meanwhile, refugees continue to arrive in droves, and Ul'dah has no clear policy on how to deal with them.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: After all, not even the sultanate's coffers are bottomless. And even assuming they had the coin, resources will ever be finite.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Which brings me back to the subject of Ifrit. It has been observed that the Amalj'aa are summoning him with ever-increasing frequency.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Every time they do so, the Ul'dahns send their forces to smite the primal, and though they invariably succeed, each victory is bought with blood. It is a war of attrition which they cannot well sustain.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Small wonder, then, that the Immortal Flames are eager to recruit more members.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: At such a desperate hour, an adventurer of your experience would be a most welcome addition to their ranks.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: For their sake, I hope that the Flame General's words struck a chord with you.

dialogue.name: CLATTERM
dialogue.text: I lost my son to the Calamity...

dialogue.name: CLATTERM
dialogue.text: Some say you couldn't take a step without stumbling over a body.

dialogue.name: CLATTERF
dialogue.text: The three Seedseers are all together!

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Our forebears were once strangers in the Twelveswood.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Fearful of the greenwrath, they hid themselves in the dark recesses of the earth. Yet they dreamed of basking in the dappled sunlight of the forest.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Through great effort, they proved their worth to the elementals, and were granted a place beneath the boughs. So it was that Gridania was born, some five centuries ago.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Working hand in hand, the Hyur and the Elezen settlers sowed the seeds of our civilization. And soon they were joined by folk of all races.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: So nourished by the waters of unity and blessed by the light of the Matron, Gridania flourished into the great nation it is today.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: (-Self-assured YouthAlphinaud-)Do you see the Gridanian standard? There, hanging behind the Elder Seedseer.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: (-Self-assured YouthAlphinaud-)The entwined serpents represent the unity between Hyur and Elezen. An elegant symbol, do you not agree?

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: In accordance with the will of the elementals, we have embraced a life of peace. Alas, our neighbors have not always sought the same for themselves─nor for us.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Though we Gridanians have no love for war, we have still less for those who would threaten our way of life. Ever have we fought to protect the sanctity of the Twelveswood.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: When the Garlean Empire brought its war of conquest to Eorzea, we rallied under the noble standard of the Twin Adder, that we might push back the encroaching darkness.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: And it was we who prepared the ground for the reformation of the Eorzean Alliance, that all the peoples of this realm might stand united against the common threat.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Five years ago, the Alliance met the armies of the Empire upon the fields of Carteneau.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: It would prove the bloodiest battle in recent memory. Countless Gridanian lives were lost.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: As supreme commander of the Order of the Twin Adder, ever shall I bear the weight of our people's sacrifice.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Alas, their loss was not the only tragedy to befall us that day, for soon came the Calamity.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: The scars borne by our forest are a constant reminder of its violence. Our lives have been irrevocably changed, each waking hour a struggle to survive.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Driven to desperation, some among us have strayed from the path of righteousness, resorting to banditry, poaching, and other unconscionable deeds.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: To compound our woes, the Ixal have returned in force, emboldened by our suffering. They test our defenses nigh without cease, and prey upon the vulnerable.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: So beleaguered from within and without, it is of little wonder that our unity now falters. Dark times are upon us.

dialogue.name: CLATTERM
dialogue.text: Time was a man could walk the highroads without fear.

dialogue.name: CLATTERM
dialogue.text: A pox on the bloody Ixal!

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: On this day, five years ago, countless Eorzeans laid down their lives that we might behold another dawn. Please join with me in honoring their memory.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: (-Cynical GirlAlisaie-)And how do you propose to honor the memory of those you cannot remember, pray tell?

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: The destruction wrought by the Calamity was indiscriminate─it dealt death to Eorzean and Garlean alike.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Yet while we have labored to rebuild our homes─to rebuild our lives─the Empire has set about raising steel fortresses here in the Twelveswood.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Let none be mistaken─the Garleans remain the greatest threat to our survival. If we are to stand against them, we must remember what it is to be united.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Our many troubles blind us to the woes of our fellow man. Thence is harmony lost. Yet harmony is the founding principle of Gridania.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: We are gathered here to honor the fallen.

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: Let them be honored not only in word and thought, but through concerted action!

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: I bid you join hands with me once more beneath the Twin Adder standard!

dialogue.name: KANESENNA
dialogue.text: And together, let us heal the forest's wounds, that our progeny might live in harmony beneath these ancient boughs. For serenity, purity, and sanctity!

dialogue.name: CLATTERF
dialogue.text: We must think of the children!

dialogue.name: CLATTERM
dialogue.text: Wood's Will Be Done!

dialogue.name: CLATTERM
dialogue.text: It's up to us to protect the forest!

dialogue.name: CLATTERM
dialogue.text: For the elementals!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: If you'll permit me. Alphinaud.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...And my sister, Alisaie, at your service.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I saw at a glance that you were a fellow traveler.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: You might call us students of history, sampling the realm's remembrances in pursuit of...enlightenment.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Fancy meeting you again.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The Gridanians are unfortunate enough to have to contend with two beast tribes.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The Ixal are unquestionably the more troublesome, being of a naturally warlike disposition, and wont to summon their bloodthirsty primal, Garuda.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The sylphs, by contrast, are peaceful in nature, being mischievous rather than malevolent, and have long been on friendly terms with the Gridanians─until recently, at least. Alas, they have grown aloof, a change observed at roughly the time they summoned the primal Ramuh.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The Gridanians have no love for war, and they consider open conflict a last resort.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Though they clash with the Ixal ever more regularly, you may be assured that they do so in self-defense. As for the sylphs...they are as yet bound by a peace treaty, though one wonders how long it will be before it is broken.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The Twelveswood was grievously wounded during the Calamity, leaving Gridania vulnerable to attack. The people are hopeful that restoring the wood─and thereby the power of the elementals─will put an end to their woes. Yet how long will that take? Centuries, I'd wager.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Meanwhile, the Ixal will continue their incursions, spurred on by Garuda and her insatiable appetite for destruction.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Whether the Gridanians like it or not, sooner or later it will come to all-out war. And when it does, the Order of the Twin Adder will need all the help it can muster.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...How valuable might the aid of a capable adventurer prove to them then?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Well, perhaps we will find out─if the Elder Seedseer's words fell on fertile ground...

dialogue.name: ZANTHAEL
dialogue.text: Here to attend the remembrance service? Be quick─the Admiral is due to give her address at any moment.

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: Proceed to the Stateroom?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: Yes

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: No

dialogue.name: ZANTHAEL
dialogue.text: If you're not interested in attending, make way for those who are.

dialogue.name: CLATTERM
dialogue.text: The Garleans are another matter altogether.

dialogue.name: CLATTERF
dialogue.text: So much for our alliance.

dialogue.name: CLATTERM
dialogue.text: It's sunk beyond the seabed.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Brothers and sisters of the sea, hearken unto me! Look upon this, our mighty crimson standard, and tell me your hearts do not swell with pride!

dialogue.name: CLATTERM
dialogue.text: Yaaaaaargh!

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Seven hundred summers have come and gone since our forefathers first ran aground in this fertile bay.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: In that time, guided by the Mother of Oceans, Limsa Lominsa has grown from humble fishing village to uncontested ruler of the five seas and beyond!

dialogue.name: CLATTERM
dialogue.text: Huzzah!

dialogue.name: CLATTERM
dialogue.text: Raaaaaarrr!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: (-Self-assured YouthAlphinaud-)Did you look, as the Admiral bid you? It is a rather stirring standard, I must say.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: (-Self-assured YouthAlphinaud-)The crimson field is meant to signify the blood of fallen crewmates, while the black longship represents a pirate vessel.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: When the Garlean Empire marched upon Eorzea, we assembled beneath the Maelstrom's standard, and our Grand Company was reborn.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: All answered the call, from the Knights of the Barracuda to Hyllfyr's Bloody Executioners, and together we met our would-be conquerors upon the field of Carteneau.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: That day, the world bore witness to the united strength of Limsa Lominsa!

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: I swear to you─no army ever fought harder, or with more courage. Yet many of ours did not survive.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Join me now in remembering those who fought in the name of freedom, and fell. May their souls be returned to the sea.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: (-Self-assured YouthAlphinaud-)Freedom... Yes, they have always been rather fond of their freedom.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: (-Self-assured YouthAlphinaud-)Much as the beast tribes have. Small wonder─beneath the surface, one would struggle to tell them apart.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: It has been five long years since the Calamity struck. Five long years of tireless rebuilding.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Yet still the wounds of the Calamity fester and weep.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: But when I stand atop the Mizzenmast, and gaze out upon our battered and broken vessel, I see an undying spirit. Did we not build all this from the wreck of the Galadion all those centuries ago? Shall we not do so again!?

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Yet there are those who would see this ship of ours sink beneath the waves of the restless Rhotano.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: The Sahagin creep ashore seeking blood for their accursed god.

dialogue.name: CLATTERM
dialogue.text: Those fishback bastards...

dialogue.name: CLATTERF
dialogue.text: The Sahagin have risen?

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: While the mines of O'Ghomoro spew forth kobolds who push ever south, despoiling our lands as they go.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: These savage beast tribes will be the first waves to crash against our creaking hull.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: And behind them swells the grim tide of the Garlean Empire.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Even now, the curs fly their flags within our borders. Doubt not but that they will be upon us ere long.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: We are well-nigh surrounded. Yet there are those among us who would rather turn their swords against their crewmates than our cannons against our foes.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: How can we hope to repel our many enemies when mutiny breeds below deck?

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: There is but one course left to us!

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: One bearing that will bring us victory over the beast hordes and the Empire both, and see this ship safe to port.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: We must mend the rift the Calamity has reopened 'twixt pirate and Maelstrom, and stand fast with our adventurer brothers against the coming tempest!

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: Mark ye well: a crew without unity is no crew at all─'tis but a mass of drowned men.

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: To me, then, brothers and sisters of the sea! Gather beneath the undying crimson standard and pledge me your strength, your skill, your wisdom!

dialogue.name: MERLWYB
dialogue.text: And with the guidance of the Navigator, this great vessel of ours shall ride the waves till sea swallows all!

dialogue.name: CLATTERM
dialogue.text: Long live the Admiral!

dialogue.name: CLATTERM
dialogue.text: Admiral Merlwyb!

dialogue.name: CLATTERF
dialogue.text: Gather the lads!

dialogue.name: CLATTERM
dialogue.text: Where's me cutlass!?

dialogue.name: CLATTERM
dialogue.text: I'll follow ye to the seven hells, Admiral!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: If you'll permit me. Alphinaud.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...And my sister, Alisaie, at your service.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I saw at a glance that you were a fellow traveler.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: You might call us students of history, sampling the realm's remembrances in pursuit of...enlightenment.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Fancy meeting you again.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: As the Admiral mentioned in her address, Limsa Lominsa is plagued by two beast tribes.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The first are the fishlike Sahagin, worshipers of the primal Leviathan.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The second are the kobolds, who dwell beneath the earth, and take the primal Titan for their god.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: As if the beast tribes' presence weren't troublesome enough, the Garleans have also chosen to erect a fortress right in the Lominsans' backyard.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: And that is to say naught of internal strife. As a nation of pirates, there is no end to the blood feuds between the various factions. And while they fight amongst themselves, the Garleans whet their blades and watch.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: If the Lominsans are to have any hope of withstanding the Empire, they must first resolve their own affairs. Differences must be set aside, and the primal threat dealt with once and for all.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: To this end, I expect that they will soon take decisive action against the beast tribes. Mark my words, the Maelstrom standard will be drenched a deeper shade of crimson ere long.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: That a capable adventurer like you would be a valuable addition to their crew is beyond question.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: But will you sail with the Admiral?

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Forename, this is Minfilia. You are well, I hope? Would I be correct in thinking that the final remembrance service has now concluded?

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: A moment ago, you say? What a coincidence!

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Jesting aside, I trust you remember our guests from the Grand Companies? Well, delighted though we are to have them here at the Waking Sands, it would not do to keep them in suspense any longer than necessary. In short: hurry back!

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Welcome back, Forename. Were the Grand Company leaders' words as illuminating as you had hoped?

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: Aye, each nation is beset with problems. I trust you see now why your services are in such demand. Would that there were more of you, Forename.

dialogue.name: MINFILIA
dialogue.text: But you must be tired from your journey. Why don't you rest awhile, and take a moment to reflect on your decision? Once your mind is made up, pray give the Grand Company officers your answer.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The gods only know what “grand” company our adventurer friend will keep.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Hmph. The wheels of change are in motion regardless.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Brother, are you certain this course is best?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Whatever do you mean, dear sister?

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: The so-called “remembrance” ceremonies were little more than standard-waving rallies.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: ...As though the Calamity and Seventh Umbral Era warranted scarcely a mention!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Well, of course they were “standard-waving rallies.”

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Since you are so observant, mayhap you noticed what mention was made of the Warriors of Light? None.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: I suppose they must have forgotten the heroes who spared Eorzea a fate worse than the Calamity?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: No, dear Alisaie, they haven't “forgotten” these details. They have elected to omit them.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Deep are the wounds the Calamity inflicted upon Eorzea. So deep, in fact, that the realm still bleeds.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Needless to say, the beast tribes and their primals do little to alleviate the pain.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: So the task of salving Eorzea's wounds falls to the Scions of the Seventh Dawn─with a little help from our friends the Grand Companies.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Remembrance will yield no remedy. If our world is to heal, we must put the horrors of the Calamity behind us.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Our grandfather would never entrust the fate of the realm to despots who rewrite history to their convenience!

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: There must be another way to cure what ails this world─and I mean to find it!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: You are most welcome to try. Our paths may differ, but our destination is the same. In time, I daresay we will see eye to eye.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I should hope so.

dialogue.name: BODYGUARDA
dialogue.text: M-M'lady!

dialogue.name: BODYGUARDB
dialogue.text: We are to escort you!

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Hope does not come into it. We share the burden of this fate, dear sister, and will prevail together or not at all.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: The salve will serve not only to close up our present wounds...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: ...but prevent old ones from opening anew.
